page.title: 04RELIGION-BROADWELL
page.content: Broadwell has two Chapels but no C.Of E. Church.One of the Chapels belongs to "The Church of the Good Shepherd",this is alongside a house in the village. Services are held once a month. The other Chapel is a Methodist one.It was built in 1872 by Thomas Walton for 100 Pounds.The Metodist Church had a lot of influence on village life,this is why there is no Public House.The Church is linked with Methodist Churches in Dunchurch,Grandborough and Daventry,with whom it shares Ministers, as there are not enough people to have a Minister just for Broadwell.The Church publishes a quarterly magazine called "The Vine".The Church also has a a choir,and holds a Fete in the summer.
